Description: Plastic female head serving as a foot of Chian, perhaps black-figured, Sphinx and Lion Style pottery vessel, possibly a kernos; white slip (mostly worn); exterior: flaring headress decorated with vertical lines and vertical dot and square pattern; painted facial features and raised dotted necklace; lotus flower held in right hand between breasts, decorated with disc and ring; garment below decorated with wavy vertical lines.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see British Museum 1888,0601.497 and 1886,0401.1399.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 317, no. 1391, pl. 179)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2193) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5930 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
